subdisciplines.name: Behavioral Game Theory
subdisciplines.description: The study of strategic decision-making in interactive settings incorporating insights from psychology and economics.

subdisciplines.name: Decision Theory
subdisciplines.description: The study of individual decision-making under uncertainty and risk, incorporating insights from cognitive psychology and behavioral economics.

subdisciplines.name: Experimental Economics
subdisciplines.description: The application of controlled experiments to provide insight into economic phenomena, accounting for behavioral factors.

subdisciplines.name: Neuroeconomics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the biological basis of decision-making, integrating methods from economics, neuroscience, and psychology.
